gurmukhi: ss`ij swiekM isqM kpMq kwmxo klM ] BRmMq BUqlM BlM BugMq BwmxI dlM ]466]
transliteration: Sasajj(i) Saaekan Sitan Kapant Kaamannd Kalan|| Bhramannd Bhootalan Bhalan Bhougadt Bhaamannddalan||466||
translation: That beautiful damsel was decorated with the arrows of her art and the group of those beautiful women was enjoying the earthly existence.466.

gurmukhi: gunvMq sIl Apwr ] ds cwr cwr audwr ] rs rwg srb spMin ] DrxI qlw mih DMin ]467]
transliteration: Gounvant Seel Apaar|| Das Chaar Chaar Udaar|| Ras Raag Sarab Sapann(i)|| Dharnitalaa Maih Dhann(i)||467||
translation: She was virtuous very gentle and knower of eighteen sciences, well versed in music and full of essence, She was fortunate enough on earth.467.

gurmukhi: iek rwg gwvq nwr ] guxvMq sIl Apwr ] suK Dwm locn cwr ] sMgIq krq ibcwr ]468]
transliteration: Ik Raag Gadvat Naar|| Gounvant Deel Apaar|| Soukh Dhaam Lochanndchaar|| Saneet Karat Bichaar||468||
translation: A woman, gentle and virtuous, was singing a musical mode; she was the abode of happiness and her eyes were charming; she was thoughtfully singing her musical modes.468.

gurmukhi: duiq mwn rUp Apwr ] guxvMq sIl audwr ] suK isMD rwg inDwn ] hir lyq hyrq pRwn ]469]
transliteration: Dout(i) Maan Roop Apaar|| Gounvant Seel Udaar|| Soukh Sindh Raag Nidhaan|| Har(i) Let Heart Praan||469||
translation: She was pretty, gentle and generous; that lady, the treasure of music, to whichever direction she viewed, she allured everyone.469.

gurmukhi: AklMk ju`bn mwn ] suK isMD suMdr Qwn ] iek ic`q gwvq rwg ] auPtMq jwn suhwg ]470]
transliteration: Akalank Joubban Maan|| Soukh Sindh Soundar Thaan|| Ik Chitt Gadvat Raag|| Ouphtant Jaan Suhaag||470||
translation: That blemishless and honourable lady was an ocean of happiness; she was singing with full concentration of mind and the auspicious songs seemed to be springing out from her very interior.470.

gurmukhi: iqh pyK kY jit rwj ] sMg lIn jog smwj ] rih rIJ Awpn ic`q ] jug rwj jog piv`q ]471]
transliteration: Tih Pekh Kai Jattee Raaj|| San Leen Jog Samaaj|| Rah(i) Reejh Aapan Chitt|| Joug Raajjog Pavitt||471||
translation: Seeing her, the king of Yogis gathered all his Yogis and all of them were pleased to see that pure Yogin.471.

gurmukhi: ieh BwNiq jo hir sMg ] ihq kIjIAY AnrMg ] qb pweIAY hir lok ] ieh bwq mY nhI Sok ]472]
transliteration: Eh Bhaant(i) Jo Her(i) San|| Hit Keejeeai Anran|| Tab Paaeeai Har(i) Lok|| Eh Baat Mai Nahishok||472||
translation: The king of Yogis thought that if in this way, detaching oneself from all other sides, the mind is concentrated on the Lord, then the Lord can be realized without any apprehension.472.

gurmukhi: icq caup so Br cwie ] gur jwn kY pr jwie ] icq qaun ky rs BIn ] gur qyeIsvo iqh kIn ]473]
transliteration: Chit Chaoup So Bhar Chaae|| Gur Jaan Kai Par Jaae|| Chit Taoun Ke Ras Bheen|| Gur Teeesavo Tih Keen||473||
translation: The enthusiastic sage, accepted her as his Guru, fell at her feet; getting absorbed in her love, the king of the sages, adopted her as his Twenty-Third Guru.473.

gurmukhi: ieiq jCxI nwr rwg gwvqI gurU qyeIsvo smwpqM ]23]
transliteration: It(i) Jachhaninaar Raag Gadvatiguroo Teeesavo Samaptan||23||
translation: End of the description of the adoption of a Yaksha woman-singer as the twenty-Third Guru.
(Now begins the description of the adoption of the Twenty-fourth Guru [carnation])
